intro: Brodiaea rosea subsp. rosea, commonly known as the pink brodiaea, is a flowering plant native to California and parts of Oregon. It belongs to the family Asparagaceae and is characterized by its striking pink to purple flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its bulbs are underground storage organs that help it survive in its native arid environments. It is often found in open habitats such as chaparral and grasslands.
